title: Avocado
summary: The avocado (Persea americana), a tree likely originating from south-central Mexico,[3][4][5] is classified as a member of the flowering plant family Lauraceae.[3] The fruit of the plant, also called an avocado (or avocado pear or alligator pear), is botanically a large berry containing a single large seed.[6] Avocado trees are partially self-pollinating, and are often propagated through grafting to maintain  predictable fruit quality and quantity.[7]
